net.proteusframework.cms.controller

Class LinkExternalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.cms.controller.LinkExternalizer

  • public class LinkExternalizer
extends Object
    Do not use for CMS code that generates HTML for web pages. This class is meant to be used outside of the CMS Request/Response cycle when a link needs to be externalized. An example would be a cron style job that sends emails that has links to CMS pages.

    Note: Externalizing links during a request is unnecessary, since it is done automatically. See CmsResponse.createURL(Link) and XMLRenderer.

    See also HTMLToPlainText for converting HTML content to plain text for emails.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

@Nullable
public net.proteusframework.internet.http.Link externalize(@Nullable
                                                                    net.proteusframework.internet.http.Link link)
        Externalize the specified link.
        Parameters:
        link - the link. If link or link.uri is null, returns null.
        Returns:
        the externalized link or the specified link if nothing was done.

      • externalize

        public String externalize(String xhtml)
        Externalize links stored in XHTML.

        This is a utility method for externalizing links. If it is appropriate (something like emails), you may want to externalize the XHTML before storage - not when using.

        This method catches and logs any errors, returning the original input if there are errors. If you need to be aware of any errors, use one of the other externalize methods.

        Parameters:
        xhtml - the XHTML.
        Returns:
        the externalized [X]HTML if there wasn't an error; otherwise, the specified xhtml is returned.
        See Also:
        externalize(String, PrintWriter), externalize(String, PrintWriter, String[])

      • externalize

        public void externalize(String xhtml,
               PrintWriter pw)
                 throws IOException
        Externalize links stored in XHTML.

        This is a utility method for externalizing links. If it is appropriate (something like emails), you may want to externalize the XHTML before storage - not when using.

        Parameters:
        xhtml - the XHTML.
        pw - the writer.
        Throws:
        IOException - on error.

      • externalize

        public void externalize(String xhtml,
               PrintWriter pw,
               String... tags)
                 throws IOException
        Externalize links stored in XHTML.

        This is a utility method for externalizing links.

        Parameters:
        xhtml - the XHTML.
        pw - the writer.
        tags - the tags to transform. See LinkExternalizeTagListener.setSupportedTags(String[]) for more information.
        Throws:
        IOException - on error.

      • setDefaultAuthority

        public final void setDefaultAuthority(String defaultAuthority)
        Set the default authority. This is typically a hostname. See URI.

        This is used when an absolute URI is created for a Link and the authority for the URI cannot otherwise be determined.

        Parameters:
        defaultAuthority - the default authority.

      • setForceSecure

        public final void setForceSecure(boolean forceSecure)
        Set the make secure flag.
        Set to true to cause externalized links to become secure.
        Defaults to false.
        Parameters:
        forceSecure - the force secure flag.

      • setMakeAbsolute

        public final void setMakeAbsolute(boolean makeAbsolute)
        Set the make absolute flag.
        Set to true to cause externalized links to become absolute.
        Defaults to true.
        Parameters:
        makeAbsolute - the make absolute flag.

      • setOutputXHTML
